alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 8:23AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF BEDFORD AND SOMERSET COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to about a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 823 AM EST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from near Windber to near Bittinger and moving southeast at 35 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Blue Knob State Park and Ogletown around 830 AM EST. Queen around 835 AM EST. St. Clairsville and Osterburg around 840 AM EST. Cessna around 845 AM EST. New Enterprise around 850 AM EST. Everett and Coaldale around 905 AM EST. * This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 70 from mile markers 147 to 150. The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 101 to 165. Interstate 99 from mile markers 0 to 14. This includes the following highways... Route 30 from the Westmoreland county line to east of Breezewood. Route 40 from Somerfield to Addison. Route 219 from the Maryland border to south of Geistown. Route 220 from the Maryland border to near King on I-99. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
